alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of the City of Norfolk, the northern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 500 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Ocean View to near Cradock. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Ocean View, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Norfolk International, Norfolk NAS, Ghent, Bowers Hill and Norview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
